ko:
A: 잘 지내시죠?
B: I'm doing great, thanks!

A: 그동안 잘 지내셨어요?
B: Yes, I've been doing well!

A: 여긴 어쩐 일이세요?
B: Just passing by and thought I'd say hi!

A: 여가 시간에 뭐 하시나요?
B: I like to read and go hiking.
en: What do you do in your spare time?

ko:
A: 여행하는 거 좋아하세요?
B: Absolutely, I try to travel whenever I can.

A: 얼마나 오래 해오셨나요?
B: About three years now.
en: How long have you been doing that?

ko:
A: 그걸 시작하게 된 계기가 있나요?
B: A friend got me into it.
en: How did you get into that?

ko:
A: 가족분들은 어떻게 지내시나요?
B: They're doing well, thanks for asking!

A: 얼마나 오래 만나신 건가요?
B: We've been together for five years.
en: How long have you been together?

ko:
A: 형제/자매가 있으시나요?
B: Yes, I have one brother.

A: 하시는 일이 어떻게 되세요?
B: I'm a graphic designer.
en: What do you do for a living?

ko:
A: 일은 어때요?
B: It's been pretty busy lately.

A: 프로젝트는 어떻게 진행되어 가요?
B: It's going well, almost done!

A: 퇴근 후 약속 있으세요?
B: Not today, I'm free.
en: Do you have any plans after work?

ko:
A: 이번 주 가장 특별한 일이 뭐였나요?
B: I finally finished that big project.
en: What was the highlight of your week?

ko:
A: How was your day?
B: 정말 힘든 하루였어.

A: Is it that late already?
B: 시간 가는 줄 몰랐어요.

A: 전공이 뭐예요?
B: I'm studying psychology.

A: 졸업 후 계획이 있으신가요?
B: I'm thinking about grad school.
en: Do you have any plans after graduation?

ko:
A: 여기 와보신 적 있으세요?
B: Yes, I come here quite often.

A: 최근에 괜찮은 영화 보신 거 있으세요?
B: I watched a great film last week.
en: Have you seen any good movies lately?

ko:
A: 근처에 괜찮은 음식점 아시나요?
B: There's a great Italian place down the street.
en: Do you know any good restaurants around here?

ko:
A: 여기서 거기까지 얼마나 걸려요?
B: About 15 minutes by car.
en: How long does it take from here?

ko:
A: What do you think of this place?
B: 전망이 정말 좋네요!

A: 새 집은 어떻게 마음에 드세요?
B: I love it, it's so spacious!
en: How do you like your new place?

ko:
A: 지난 주말에 뭐 하셨어요?
B: I went hiking with some friends.
en: What did you do last weekend?

ko:
A: Can you believe it's been a year already?
B: 시간 참 빨리 가네요.

A: What day is it today?
B: 주말이 코앞으로 다가왔네요.
en: The weekend is just around the corner.

ko:
A: Do you ever think about your university days?
B: 대학 시절이 그리워요.

A: What does this make you think of?
B: 이걸 보니 대학시절이 생각나네요.

A: How's the weather looking?
B: 봄기운이 완연하네요.

A: How are you holding up in this heat?
B: 정말 덥네요! 녹아내릴 것 같아요.

A: How's the weather outside?
B: 밖에 정말 춥네요!

A: 여긴 뭐가 맛있나요?
B: The pizza here is amazing.

A: What's cooking?
B: 맛있는 냄새가 나네요.

A: 조금 드셔 보실래요?
B: Sure, I'd love to try it!
en: Would you like to try some?

ko:
A: 그거 맛있어 보이는데 뭔가요?
B: It's lasagna.
en: That looks good. What is it?

ko:
A: What did you think of dinner?
B: 요리 정말 잘 하시네요!

A: Any recommendations for good coffee?
B: 그 카페에 한번 가보세요.
en: You should check out that cafe.

ko:
A: 요즘 운동하세요?
B: Yeah, I've been going to the gym.

A: What do you think of this outfit?
B: 원피스가 마음에 드는걸요.

A: How does this look on me?
B: 그 셔츠가 잘 어울려요.
en: That shirt looks good on you.

ko:
A: 그거 어디에서 사셨나요?
B: I got it at the mall.

A: Do I look different?
B: 조금도 안 변하셨어요.

A: 헤어스타일 바꾸셨나요?
B: Yes, I got it cut yesterday.

A: What a coincidence seeing you here!
B: 이렇게 만나니 정말 반가운걸요!
en: I'm glad I ran into you!

ko:
A: How are you feeling after that long trip?
B: 피곤하시겠어요.

A: 즐거운 시간 보내고 계시나요?
B: Yes, I'm having a great time!
en: Are you having a good time?

ko:
A: It's so hot today!
B: 물 많이 드세요.

A: I have a big presentation tomorrow.
B: 잘 진행되길 바라요.

A: I should get going.
B: 대화 즐거웠어요.
en: It was nice talking to you.

ko:
A: Thanks for spending time with me today.
B: 함께 해서 즐거웠어요.

A: We should hang out again soon.
B: 언제 시간 될 때 커피 한잔해요.

A: I'll be moving to another city soon.
B: 연락하고 지내요.

A: I'm heading out now.
B: 좋은 하루 보내세요!

A: See you on Monday!
B: 주말 잘 보내세요!

A: I'm leaving now.
B: 안전하게 집에 들어가세요.

A: Thanks for coming!
B: 조심해서 가세요.

A: I hope to see you again.
B: 오늘 만나서 반가웠어요.
en: It was great meeting you today.

ko:
A: Take care!
B: 나중에 또 봬요.

A: When will I see you again?
B: 곧 다시 만나요.

A: It was a great event!
B: 오늘 참석해 주셔서 감사합니다.

A: Did you have a good time?
B: 초대해 주셔서 감사합니다.

A: I really appreciate it!
B: 도와주셔서 감사합니다.

A: 어떻게 지내세요?
B: I'm doing well, thanks!

A: How are you doing?
B: 예전만 못해요.

A: How's everything going?
B: 그럭저럭 지내요.

A: What have you been up to?
B: 정신없이 바빠요.

A: What have you been doing lately?
B: 별일 없어요.

A: Anything new?
B: 늘 똑같죠 뭐.

A: Wow, is that really you?
B: 오랜만이에요!

A: I haven't seen you in forever!
B: 정말 오랜만이네요!

A: What are you doing here?
B: 여기서 만날 줄은 몰랐어요.
en: I didn't expect to see you here.

ko:
A: Look who's here!
B: 정말 반가워요!

A: Hi, I'm Alex.
B: 처음 뵙겠습니다.

A: I've been looking forward to meeting you.
B: 만나서 반갑습니다.
en: It's a pleasure to meet you.

ko:
A: Has anyone mentioned me?
B: 많이 들었어요.
en: I've heard a lot about you.

ko:
A: I love this song!
B: 저도 그래요!

A: I really enjoyed that movie.
B: 저도 마찬가지예요.

A: Sometimes I feel overwhelmed by work.
B: 완전 공감해요.

A: What do you think?
B: 정말 그렇네요.

A: I never thought of it that way.
B: 좋은 지적이에요.

A: Did you know that?
B: 재미있네요!

A: She actually said yes!
B: 정말요?

A: I won the lottery!
B: 진짜요?

A: I'm thinking of quitting my job.
B: 농담이시죠?

A: I just ran a marathon!
B: 놀랍네요!

A: I got the promotion!
B: 멋지네요!

A: I finally finished my thesis!
B: 잘됐네요!

A: I didn't get the job.
B: 유감이에요.

A: The concert was cancelled.
B: 안됐네요.

A: I'm going through a tough time.
B: 힘내세요.

A: I'm worried about the interview.
B: 다 잘될 거예요.

A: Sorry about the mess.
B: 걱정 마세요.

A: Thanks for helping me out.
B: 문제없어요.

A: Let me pay for this.
B: 제 차례예요.

A: Can I pay you back?
B: 제가 살게요.

A: Should we get something to eat?
B: 배고파 죽겠어요.

A: Would you like some more?
B: 너무 배불러요.

A: You seem stressed.
B: 휴가가 필요해요.
